From: "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@...>


Thanx, love.

* D kept up sniffing, staying in a tight ball.
This was a strange place and he was all questions but not knowing if he knew 
enough words to express it.
The people here were all coverd in some smooth coating, hard to the touch. 
Not like the skin of his keepers. It was soft and pale peach. These people's 
skin was all colors.
D had never seen a sky before, or an ocean or anything that would exist on a 
planet. But that's what happened when a being was born and raised on a 
startship all of their life.
His nose smelled things that were both pleasent and foul, it traveling less 
then an inch off the ground as it went along.
D flinched as Fenox(sp) touched his shoulder, his head snapping towards her, 
his ears still flat against his head. The hair along his neck had stoiod up 
for a moment or two but settled down, just surprised.
She was the first person he had seen and felt a slight tie to her, like some 
life line to hold onto while drowning in the events of a strange world.
D shifted on his fromt limbs, his hands/paws shifting the dirt slightly. He 
looked at the ground and then back at her, then did it again. Searching for 
something of his limited speech to say that might communicate his 
puzzlement.
He wanted to learn as much as he could about this place, as well as finding 
out just what had happened to the ship and people he was with less then a 
day ago.
D whined. What words to use?*

" No know."

* That wasn't the answer to Fenox's question. He was saying that he didn't 
know where he was, so he wanted someone to tell him. But with words like 
that people could have a hard time trying to understand him.
But...maybe he could go at it another way? With more understandable words.*

" No know where is."

* That was as close to, " I don't know where I am," as he was going to get. 
But he just hoped that she could understand.*
